metadata.feature_description: View and manage activity stream on user profiles

steps.action: Navigate to own profile Activity Feed at /Activity-Feed/userId/1
steps.expected: Profile Activity Feed page loads with user info and activity posts
steps.actual: Successfully loaded SuperUser Account profile with 112 points, Activity Feed tab visible

steps.expected: Activity posts display with timestamps, like/comment options
steps.actual: Multiple activity posts visible with timestamps, Like, Comment, Subscribe/Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin options

steps.action: Navigate to Test Editor's profile at /Activity-Feed/userId/3
steps.expected: Other user's profile Activity Feed loads with their info
steps.actual: Successfully loaded Test Editor profile showing Friends: 0, Following: 0, Followers: 0, Points: 6

steps.action: View activity posts on other user's profile
steps.actual: Test Editor's activity posts visible including badge earned notification, post creation area available

steps.action: Click on post creation area on own profile
steps.expected: Post creation box activates with Share button
steps.actual: Post creation area activated, Share button appeared

steps.expected: Post is created and appears in activity stream
steps.actual: Post 'Test post for Profile Activity Stream testing - January 9, 2026' created successfully and visible in activity stream with Like, Comment, Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin options

steps.action: Navigate to Test Editor's profile and activate post creation
steps.expected: Post creation area available on friend's profile
steps.actual: Post creation area with 'Tell the world something...' placeholder available on Test Editor's profile

steps.action: Enter text and click Share to post on friend's wall
steps.expected: Post appears on friend's profile wall
steps.actual: Post 'Test post on friend's profile wall - January 9, 2026' created successfully and visible on Test Editor's profile with Like, Comment, Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin options

steps.action: Navigate to Edit my profile to find privacy settings
steps.expected: Profile privacy settings UI should be accessible
steps.actual: Edit profile page shows Manage Account, Manage Profile, and Communications tabs. No dedicated Privacy Settings section found.

steps.action: Search for privacy controls in post creation
steps.actual: Post creation only shows Share button, no privacy selector visible. Existing posts show privacy was applied (e.g., 'Privacy Test: Private', 'Privacy Test: Friends') but UI does not expose privacy controls

issues: No UI element found to configure profile-level privacy settings
Post creation does not expose privacy/security set selector despite code supporting E/C/F/U security sets
Privacy controls exist in backend code but are not exposed in the current UI

steps.action: Use 'Filter by activity' dropdown to select 'Posts'
steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only posts
steps.actual: Dropdown filter worked - activity stream now shows only Posts type entries, filtering out photos, badges, and other activity types

steps.action: Click on custom saved filter 'Photos and Wiki Filter'
steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only photos and wiki activities
steps.actual: Custom filter worked - activity stream now shows only photos and wiki article entries

steps.action: Click Unsubscribe on a post to test subscription toggle
steps.expected: Unsubscribe action changes link to Subscribe
steps.actual: Clicked Unsubscribe, link changed to 'Subscribe' confirming unsubscription

steps.expected: Subscribe action changes link back to Unsubscribe
steps.actual: Clicked Subscribe, link changed back to 'Unsubscribe' confirming successful subscription

observations: Code in ActivityStreamServicesController.cs supports security sets (E=Everyone, C=Community, F=Friends, U=User) for post privacy, but the UI does not expose a selector to choose these options when creating posts
Posts display as 'Anonymous' author in some cases, possibly related to the testing environment configuration
The Persona Bar admin panel iframe sometimes blocks UI interactions and needs to be hidden programmatically
Custom Activity Stream Filters (saved filters) are functional and accessible from the sidebar
